document_title: Nasopharyngeal cancer: Causes, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Nasopharyngeal cancer is a disease that includes nasopharyngeal cancer (the upper part of the throat, just behind the nose), oropharyngeal cancer (the middle part of the throat), and hypopharyngeal cancer, also known as hypopharyngeal cancer (the lower part of the throat). end of the throat). This is a common disease in the group of "head and neck cancer". (first)
The pharynx is a hollow tube about 10cm long, starting behind the nose and ending at the upper end of the esophagus.
Nasopharyngeal cancer has different causes, symptoms, and prognosis depending on the location and stage of the malignancy. However, a common point of the disease is that most originate from squamous epithelium (thin, flat cells that look like fish scales).
